headline: Review & Preview: Where Are the Bears?
summary: The stock market hit another small bump today, but not before the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite touched their highest intraday levels on record.  The S&P 500 closed down 0.3%, while the Nasdaq was off 0.1%.  Stocks got off to a strong start after PepsiCo and Delta Air Lines reported quarterly results (more on that below), but the earnings trickle wasn’t enough to boost the rest of the market.

headline: PepsiCo Taps Walmart Executive as New CFO
summary: PepsiCo logged higher revenue in its fiscal third quarter, though profit slipped as volumes fell. The company also tapped a Walmart executive to fill its top finance role as PepsiCo aims to turn around its slowing soda and snack sales.

content.title: PepsiCo Taps Walmart Executive as New CFO
content.summary: PepsiCo logged higher revenue in its fiscal third quarter, though profit slipped as volumes fell. The company also tapped a Walmart executive to fill its top finance role as PepsiCo aims to turn around its slowing soda and snack sales.

headline: Playing the beverage space: Why BofA's top stock pick isn't PepsiCo
summary: PepsiCo (PEP) is making big changes in some of its snack products in an effort to appeal to more health-conscious consumers. Bank of America Securities food and beverage analyst Peter Galbo joins Market Domination with Josh Lipton to discuss how to play the food and beverage space as shifting consumer attitudes are weighing on names like PepsiCo and Corona-maker Constellation Brands (STZ). Galbo also shares one stock in the space he has a Buy rating on. Check out Yahoo Finance's interviews with Constellation Brands CEO Bill Newlands and PepsiCo CEO Ramon Laguarta. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Dow Drops 240 Points. Stocks Fall Despite Positive Earnings Reports.
summary: The first real trickle of earnings reports on Thursday were positive, but the stock market pulled back from record levels anyway.  The Nasdaq Composite was down 0.1%.  A majority of S&P 500 stocks fell after both the S&P and Nasdaq closed at records on Wednesday.

headline: PepsiCo CEO: Brand overhauls will give 'functionality' to snacking
summary: While beating third quarter earnings and revenue estimates, PepsiCo (PEP) is still signaling some weakness in its snack food segment amid the company's brand overhaul and restructuring plans. The stock is getting a lift on Thursday, but it still sees slight year-to-date losses in 2025. PepsiCo chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta sits down with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to talk more about the company's vision for innovation, snack demand from American consumers, the latest product offerings from top PepsiCo brands, and the company's collaboration with activist investor Elliott Management. Also catch RBC Capital Markets managing director Nik Modi share his thoughts on how PepsiCo is choosing to chase value. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: PepsiCo CEO: Brand overhauls will give 'functionality' to snacking
content.description:
While beating third quarter earnings and revenue estimates, PepsiCo (PEP) is still signaling some weakness in its snack food segment amid the company's brand overhaul and restructuring plans. The stock is getting a lift on Thursday, but it still sees slight year-to-date losses in 2025.

PepsiCo chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta sits down with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to talk more about the company's vision for innovation, snack demand from American consumers, the latest product offerings from top PepsiCo brands, and the company's collaboration with activist investor Elliott Management.

Also catch RBC Capital Markets managing director Nik Modi share his thoughts on how PepsiCo is choosing to chase value.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.
content.summary: While beating third quarter earnings and revenue estimates, PepsiCo (PEP) is still signaling some weakness in its snack food segment amid the company's brand overhaul and restructuring plans. The stock is getting a lift on Thursday, but it still sees slight year-to-date losses in 2025. PepsiCo chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta sits down with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to talk more about the company's vision for innovation, snack demand from American consumers, the latest product offerings from top PepsiCo brands, and the company's collaboration with activist investor Elliott Management. Also catch RBC Capital Markets managing director Nik Modi share his thoughts on how PepsiCo is choosing to chase value. headline: Lay’s Chips Are Getting a Makeover for the MAHA Era
summary: Potatoes being harvested for Lay’s chips.  Lay’s is America’s top-selling brand of potato chips, a category synonymous with junk food.  Barbecue flavors will be reformulated to remove artificial coloring used to give the chips their signature red-brown color.

headline: Cheetos makeover & protein Doritos: Why PepsiCo is revamping snacks
summary: PepsiCo (PEP) stock is in focus after releasing third quarter earnings and unveiling plans to overhaul its snack business to better appeal to consumers. Yahoo Finance Senior Consumer Reporter Brooke DiPalma outlines PepsiCo's four initiatives to revamp the snack business, as Senior Reporter Ines Ferré shares the consumer perspective on how the new offerings could better appeal to customers. Robinhood chief investment officer Stephanie Guild weighs in on what the change means for investors and the company's ongoing turnaround efforts. Read up on PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta's comments to Yahoo Finance about the brand's restructuring plan. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: US stocks and gold, Fed rate cuts, Delta & PepsiCo: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are hovering near their flatlines in Thursday's premarket after the S&P 500 (^GSPC) and Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) rallied to record highs on Wednesday. Gold (GC=F) eyes $4,100 per ounce as it continues its own record run. The Federal Reserve's minutes from its September FOMC meeting revealed that officials are still willing to cut interest rates further in 2025. Shares of Delta Air Lines (DAL) and PepsiCo (PEP) are both up in extended hours after both companies beat third quarter earnings expectations. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

The Federal Reserve's minutes from its September FOMC meeting revealed that officials are still willing to cut interest rates further in 2025.

Shares of Delta Air Lines (DAL) and PepsiCo (PEP) are both up in extended hours after both companies beat third quarter earnings expectations.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: PepsiCo Stock Rises After Earnings Beat. The Company Is Getting a New CFO.
summary: PepsiCo  stock climbed after the snacks and beverage company reported slightly better-than-expected quarterly results and announced a new chief financial officer early Thursday.  Third-quarter adjusted earnings came in at $2.29 a share on sales of $23.9 billion.  Analysts polled by FactSet had expected per-share earnings of $2.26 on sales of $23.8 billion.

content.title: PepsiCo Stock Rises After Earnings Beat. The Company Is Getting a New CFO.
content.summary: PepsiCo  stock climbed after the snacks and beverage company reported slightly better-than-expected quarterly results and announced a new chief financial officer early Thursday.  Third-quarter adjusted earnings came in at $2.29 a share on sales of $23.9 billion.  Analysts polled by FactSet had expected per-share earnings of $2.26 on sales of $23.8 billion.

headline: Market Movers: Delta and Pepsico report strong Q3 earnings
summary: PepsiCo's (PEP) third-quarter sales and earnings slightly beat Wall Street expectations. Meanwhile, Delta (DAL) reported strong Q3 earnings and the firm’s CEO sees 'significant improvement' in the airline revenue outlook. Michael Landsberg from private wealth management firm, Landsberg Bennett explained why he was still not a fan of PepsiCo but saw some value in buying Delta. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: PepsiCo’s (NASDAQ:PEP) Q3 Earnings Results: Revenue In Line With Expectations
summary: Food and beverage company PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 2.7% year on year to $23.94 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.29 per share was 1.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: PepsiCo’s (NASDAQ:PEP) Q3 Earnings Results: Revenue In Line With Expectations
content.summary: Food and beverage company PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 2.7% year on year to $23.94 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.29 per share was 1.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: PepsiCo (PEP) Tops Q3 Earnings and Revenue Estimates

headline: PepsiCo stock climbs as third-quarter results beat estimates
summary: Investing.com -- PepsiCo reported better-than-expected third-quarter results on Wednesday, as the beverage and snack giant’s revenue growth accelerated despite volume challenges in its food business.

content.title: PepsiCo stock climbs as third-quarter results beat estimates
content.summary: Investing.com -- PepsiCo reported better-than-expected third-quarter results on Wednesday, as the beverage and snack giant’s revenue growth accelerated despite volume challenges in its food business.

headline: PepsiCo, fresh off a strong third quarter, says new products will soon boost customer demand
summary: PepsiCo expressed confidence Thursday that new products — including protein-infused Starbucks coffee, low-sugar Gatorade and Doritos with all-natural ingredients — will boost flagging consumer demand in the coming year.  PepsiCo said Thursday that its food business revenue fell 3% in North America in the third quarter.  “Innovation is critical for us, and we’ve been working with a real sense of urgency on new platforms to capture segments of the market that are disproportionately growing,” Laguarta said during a conference call with investors.

content.title: PepsiCo, fresh off a strong third quarter, says new products will soon boost customer demand
content.summary: PepsiCo expressed confidence Thursday that new products — including protein-infused Starbucks coffee, low-sugar Gatorade and Doritos with all-natural ingredients — will boost flagging consumer demand in the coming year.  PepsiCo said Thursday that its food business revenue fell 3% in North America in the third quarter.  “Innovation is critical for us, and we’ve been working with a real sense of urgency on new platforms to capture segments of the market that are disproportionately growing,” Laguarta said during a conference call with investors.

headline: Stocks Muted Before the Open With Earnings Season in Focus
summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are up +0.01%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are down -0.03% this morning, steadying after yesterday’s gains as investors shift their focus to the third-quarter earnings season.

headline: PepsiCo: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: PURCHASE, N.Y. (AP) — PepsiCo Inc. PEP) on Thursday reported third-quarter earnings of $2.6 billion. On a per-share basis, the Purchase, New York-based company said it had profit of $1.90.

headline: PepsiCo Announces New Chief Financial Officer
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ: PEP) today named Steve Schmitt Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective November 10, 2025. Jamie Caulfield has decided to retire next year after a more than 30-year career with the company. Jamie will remain CFO until November 10, 2025, at which time he will assume an advisory role and assist with the transition through May 15, 2026.

content.title: PepsiCo Announces New Chief Financial Officer
content.summary: PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ: PEP) today named Steve Schmitt Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective November 10, 2025. Jamie Caulfield has decided to retire next year after a more than 30-year career with the company. Jamie will remain CFO until November 10, 2025, at which time he will assume an advisory role and assist with the transition through May 15, 2026.

headline: Wall Street's feverish rally takes a break as US stocks and gold pull back from their records
summary: Wall Street took a pause on Thursday as U.S. stocks and even the price of gold pulled back from record highs following torrid runs.  The S&P 500 slipped 0.3% from its latest all-time high for just its second loss in the last 10 days.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 243 points, or 0.5%, and the Nasdaq composite edged down by 0.1%.

content.title: Wall Street's feverish rally takes a break as US stocks and gold pull back from their records
content.summary: Wall Street took a pause on Thursday as U.S. stocks and even the price of gold pulled back from record highs following torrid runs.  The S&P 500 slipped 0.3% from its latest all-time high for just its second loss in the last 10 days.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 243 points, or 0.5%, and the Nasdaq composite edged down by 0.1%.
